attributes.text:
High-performance, high-level DOM element creation and management.

Includes support for HTML and style attributes. Elements also have got a powerful children and visibility management.

Processes DOM insertion and modification with advanced logic to reduce the real transactions.

From the view of the parent you can use the following children management methods: {@link #getChildren}, {@link #indexOf}, {@link #hasChild}, {@link #add}, {@link #addAt}, {@link #remove}, {@link #removeAt}, {@link #removeAll}

Each child itself also has got some powerful methods to control its position: {@link #getParent}, {@link #free}, {@link #insertInto}, {@link #insertBefore}, {@link #insertAfter}, {@link #moveTo}, {@link #moveBefore}, {@link #moveAfter},
Tag name of the element to create
optional map of CSS styles, where the key is the name of the style and the value is the value to use.
optional map of element attributes, where the key is the name of the attribute and the value is the value to use.
Whether the given DOM element will become invisible after the flush
Schedule a deferred element queue flush. If the widget subsystem is used this method gets overwritten by {@link qx.ui.core.queue.Manager}.
Internal helper for all children addition needs
an exception if the given element is already a child of this element
Syncs data of an HtmlElement object to the DOM.
Internal helper for all children move needs
an exception if the given element is not a child of this element
optional list of arguments for the action
Takes the action to process as argument and queues this action if the underlying DOM element is not yet created.
Internal helper for all children removal needs
an exception if the given element is not a child of this element

Walk up the internal children hierarchy and look if one of the children is marked as root.

This method is quite performance hungry as it really walks up recursively.

Applies a special property with the given value.

This property apply routine can be easily overwritten and extended by sub classes to add new low level features which are not easily possible using styles and attributes.
Whether the copy should respect styles given from markup

Copies data between the internal representation and the DOM. This simply copies all the data and only works well directly after element creation. After this the data must be synced using {@link #_syncData}
Internal helper to generate the DOM element
Get the value of the given misc.
Append all child nodes to the DOM element. This function is used when the element is initially created. After this initial apply {@link #_syncChildren} is used instead.
Whether the value should be removed directly (without queuing)
Add the element to the global modification list.
Whether the value should be applied directly (without queuing)
Syncronize internal children hierarchy to the DOM. This is used for further runtime updates after the element has been created initially.
Syncronizes data between the internal representation and the DOM. This is the counterpart of {@link #_copyData} and is used for further updates after the element has been created.
Mark this element to get activated on the next flush of the queue
Append all given children at the end of this element.
the index (starts at 0 for the first child) to insert (the index of the following children will be increased by one)
Inserts a new element into this element at the given position.
Adds an event listener to the element.
An opaque id, which can be used to remove the event listener using the {@link #removeListenerById} method.
Mark this element to get blurred on the next flush of the queue
If true all events originating in the container are captured. If false events originating in the container are not captured.
Captures all mouse events to this element

Clears the selection of the element.

This method only works if the underlying DOM element is already created.
Mark this element to get deactivated on the next flush of the queue
Marks the element as excluded which means it will be removed from the DOM and ignored for updates until it gets included again.

Focus this element.

If the underlaying DOM element is not yet created, the focus is queued for processing after the element creation.
Returns a map of all styles. Do not modify the result map!
All styles or null when none are configured.
Get the value of the given attribute.
Get a child element at the given index
The child element or null if no child is found at that index.

Returns a copy of the internal children structure.

Please do not modify the array in place. If you need to work with the data in such a way make yourself a copy of the data first.
Returns the DOM element (if created). Please use this with caution. It is better to make all changes to the object itself using the public API rather than to the underlying DOM element.
Returns the nodeName of the DOM element.
Get the value of the given style attribute.

Get the selection of the element.

If the underlaying DOM element is not yet created, this methods returns a null value.

Get the end of the selection of the element.

If the underlaying DOM element is not yet created, this methods returns a null value.

Get the length of selection of the element.

If the underlaying DOM element is not yet created, this methods returns a null value.

Get the start of the selection of the element.

If the underlaying DOM element is not yet created, this methods returns a null value.
Whether the given element is a child of this element.
Returns true when the given element is a child of this element.
Returns whether the element has any child nodes
Whether the element has any child nodes
Whether to check for listeners of the bubbling or of the capturing phase.
Check if there are one or more listeners for an event type.
Whether the object has a listener of the given type.
Marks the element as hidden which means it will kept in DOM (if it is already there, but configured hidden using a CSS style of display=none).
Marks the element as included which means it will be moved into the DOM again and synced with the internal data representation.
Find the position of the given child
returns the position. If the element is not a child -1 will be returned.
Insert self into the given parent. Normally appends self to the end, but optionally a position can be defined. With index 0 it will be inserted at the begin.
Whether the element is focusable (or will be when created)
Whether the element is part of the DOM
Whether the element is part of the DOM.

Whether the element is natively focusable (or will be when created)

This ignores the configured tabIndex.

Whether the element is visible.

Please note: This does not control the visibility or parent inclusion recursively.
Returns true when the element is configured to be visible.
the index (starts at 0 for the first child)
Move self to the given index in the current parent.
an exception when the given element is not child of this element.
Releases this element from a previous {@link #capture} call
the position of the child (starts at 0 for the first child)
Removes the child at the given index
Whether the value should be removed directly (without queuing)
Removes an event listener from the element.
Removes an event listener from an event target by an id returned by {@link #addListener}
Whether the value should be removed directly (without queuing)
The element to scroll into the viewport.
Alignment of the element. Allowed values: left or right. Could also be null. Without a given alignment the method tries to scroll the widget with the minimum effort needed.
Whether the execution should be made directly when possible

Scrolls the given child element into view. Only scrolls children. Do not influence elements on top of this element.

If the element is currently invisible it gets scrolled automatically at the next time it is visible again (queued).
The element to scroll into the viewport.
Alignment of the element. Allowed values: top or bottom. Could also be null. Without a given alignment the method tries to scroll the widget with the minimum effort needed.
Whether the execution should be made directly when possible

Scrolls the given child element into view. Only scrolls children. Do not influence elements on top of this element.

If the element is currently invisible it gets scrolled automatically at the next time it is visible again (queued).
Whether the scrolling should be performed during element flush.
Scrolls the element to the given left position.
Whether the scrolling should be performed during element flush.
Scrolls the element to the given top position.
Whether the value should be applied directly (without queuing)
a map where the key is the name of the property and the value is the value to use.
Whether the values should be applied directly (without queuing)
Convenience method to modify a set of attributes at once.
Sets the nodeName of the DOM element.
Sets the element’s root flag, which indicates whether the element should be a root element or not.
True, if the element should be selectable.
Set whether the element is selectable. It uses the qooxdoo attribute qxSelectable with the values ‘on’ or ‘off’. In webkit, a special css property will be used (-webkit-user-select).
Whether the value should be applied directly (without queuing)
a map where the key is the name of the property and the value is the value to use.
Whether the values should be applied directly (without queuing)
Convenience method to modify a set of styles at once.

Set the selection of the element with the given start and end value. If no end value is passed the selection will extend to the end.

This method only works if the underlying DOM element is already created.
Marks the element as visible which means that a previously applied CSS style of display=none gets removed and the element will inserted into the DOM, when this had not already happened before.
Uses an existing element instead of creating one. This may be interesting when the DOM element is directly needed to add content etc.
HTML markup with one root element which is used as the main element for this instance.
Uses existing markup for this element. This is mainly used to insert pre-built markup blocks into the element hierarchy.
